channel.title: about Xen atmosphere
channel.description:
ok. first when i played HL and got on xen i didn't understood how freeman could breath then i saw bodyes of other people with HEV suit and understood but.... how Shephard and Barney could breath they didn't have required equipment.... so what's your idea???
( i think this is a right place for this topic.... yes? :slight_smile: or no? :frowning: )

item.title: about Xen atmosphere
item.dc:creator: eateroftheflame
item.description:
Since xen aliens can live comfortably on Earth the atmosphere of both worlds must be similar. And on the Gearbox canonicity debate they are canon until stated otherwise by Valve, a bit like the Star Wars expanded universe.

Read full topic

item.title: about Xen atmosphere
item.dc:creator: Flatline
item.description:
Rdjp:

Yes because the xen creatures can live on earth perminantly as they cannont return to xen e.g. the headcrabs and antlions so xen must have a oxygen atmosphere

Nitrogen, if you must pin it down to one element.

Read full topic

item.title: about Xen atmosphere
item.dc:creator: snakedoctor
item.description:
taxi_evil:

Shephard had a respirator…

The mask Cpl Shephard wears is not a respirator. the M40A1 gas mask is designed to keep biological/nuclear particles out of the air supply, not supply air.

Mangled*:

Blue Shift and Opposing Force aren’t canon… so they should be ignored.

Of course, Kleiners teleport in Half-Life 2 takes Gordon and Alyx to Xen briefly (in the teleportation process) in order for them to reach Black Mesa East. So I guess a HEV suit is not required to survive on Xen.

Of course the first explorers on Xen wore HEV suits with helmets as they most likely didn’t expect an Earth-like atmosphere which Xen apparently has.

We can only assume this much.

how are they not canon? it shows how barney and a few scientists got out of black mesa, and what happens to the complex after gordon leaves.

also, if the aliens from xen can breath earth’s atmosphere it wouldn’t be far to believe that the opposite is true.

sorry if this was all brought up already, too much to read when i’m about to sleep.

Read full topic

item.title: about Xen atmosphere
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
Negative pressure is pressure, like negative numbers are still numbers.

func_random:

Simply because there is enough mass overall to attract and keep particles.
Drew my own this time:

Think kinda like that, except the picture loops whenever you look at the rock things.

This is interesting in theory, but that would probably result in “Super Mario Galaxy” gravity. In order for it to have more unidirectional gravity it would have to be near a large source of mass. I suppose darkmatter could explain it, but I just like xen better when it’s unexplained.

Read full topic

item.description:
All this talk about science is making me dizzy

Read full topic

item.title: about Xen atmosphere
item.dc:creator: baconeggs
item.description:
In a nutshell: No air pushing in on an object causes the air inside it to push outwards ie, explosive decompression. Like a gremlin in a microwave!

Read full topic

item.title: about Xen atmosphere
item.dc:creator: KMCA
item.description:
Mango Assassin:

that if there is no air, the pressure is enormous.

agreed. NEGATIVE pressure on a object such as a pressurized object in space. The negative (i.e. sucking pressure i.e. deCOMPRESSION) pressure of the surroundings create a strain or pressure on an object under pressure

I think I now hold the record for mentioning the word pressure in a sentance.

Read full topic

item.title: about Xen atmosphere
item.dc:creator: func_random
item.description:
Dias:

While that is true, most things with enough gravity to have an atmosphere are usually weathered into spheres by their own atmosphere. Also, no such giant mass can be seen anywhere in Xen, so why bring it up?

Simply because there is enough mass overall to attract and keep particles.
Drew my own this time:

Think kinda like that, except the picture loops whenever you look at the rock things.

Read full topic

item.title: about Xen atmosphere
item.dc:creator: Ford_Prefect
item.description:
Mango Assassin:
Wiki:

The key concerns for a human without protective clothing beyond Earth’s atmosphere are the following, listed roughly in the descending order of mortal significance: ebullism, hypoxia, hypocapnia, [COLOR=‘Red’]decompression[/SIZE] sickness, extreme temperature variations and cellular mutation and destruction from high energy photons and (sub-atomic) particles

So, unless you are referring to the pressure inside your body pushing outward, then you are wrong. There is no pressure in space without atmosphere.

To get more pressure, you’d have to be in something more dense than atmosphere (air.) For example water:

Futurama:

LEELA: Depth at 45 hundred feet, 48 hundred, 50 hundred! 5000 feet!

FARNSWORTH: Dear Lord, that’s over 150 atmospheres of pressure.

FRY: How many atmospheres can this ship withstand?

FARNSWORTH: Well it’s a spaceship, so I’d say anywhere between zero and one.

1 Atm: Earth
0 Atm: Space

Read full topic

item.title: about Xen atmosphere
item.dc:creator: Flatline
item.description:
Well, that’s simply not true. And what you quoted didn’t prove your point. In fact, it states the opposite (i.e. my point). The air is what creates the pressure.

Read full topic

item.title: about Xen atmosphere
item.dc:creator: Mango_Assassin
item.description:
Flatline:

Um, yes. I’m aware of all of this. I don’t see how it has any bearing on what I said.

that if there is no air, the pressure is enormous.

Read full topic

item.title: about Xen atmosphere
item.dc:creator: Flatline
item.description:
Mango Assassin:
Flatline:

If there was no ‘air’ there’s be no pressure whatsoever. That’s kinda how air works.

dont get me wrong here, im not trying to be arsy or anything, but realistically Xen looks like it is in space, its defined as;
“A collection of asteroids hanging over a nebula”

so, it is in space,

“The key concerns for a human without protective clothing beyond Earth’s atmosphere are the following, listed roughly in the descending order of mortal significance: ebullism, hypoxia, hypocapnia, decompression sickness, extreme temperature variations and cellular mutation and destruction from high energy photons and (sub-atomic) particles” - Wiki

You would be in tempratures of up to -270°C and unable to breath.

each to their own though eh?

They also cocked that up in my favourite film Sunshine.

Edit - Brighton in uk.

Um, yes. I’m aware of all of this. I don’t see how it has any bearing on what I said.

Read full topic

item.title: about Xen atmosphere
item.dc:creator: JohnWorfin
item.description:
baconeggs:

Considering Xen is in an entirely different dimension, space for them might be full of air.

Don’t forget about the giant testicle/sac monster, the three armed floating babies, plants that stab you, flying mantas, and The giant/floating/energy shooting from its head/forcing you to teleport/baby-boss.
